fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2084].
  {panel}

h2.Summary
Hidden fields that can't be shown on the Customer Portal, doesn't set the default value when request is created by customers.
These type of fields are displayed with the "Show" option greyed out under Service Desk "Request Types" section.
Hovering over the "Show" option displays the message: *"This field type can't be displayed in Customer Portal"*
e.g fields: Epic Link, Assignee

This affects Issues Created by the Customer Portal as well as Email

h2.Step to Replicate
# Under a *Request Type* configure the screen and add Epic Link as a hidden field.
# Set the default value of the Epic Link to an existing epic link.
# Login as a SD Customer (or create a new one for testing purposes); raise a request with the above request type. 
*Expected Result:* Epic Link field is set to the default epic link and shown at JIRA ticket view screen.
*Current Result:* Epic link field is empty and thus not showing on the JIRA ticket view screen.

h2.Notes
The problem doesn't affect agents.
The event that sets these fields requires edit permissions for the field and so it fails when Customers don't meet those requirements.

JIRA logs the following warning:
{noformat}
2015-08-26 10:19:06,507 Caesium-1-4 WARN email@address.com     [c.a.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor] Dangerous use of multiple connections: taken => count=3; marks=[3-3]; pool=3/-1
java.lang.AssertionError: Explicit stack trace requested
      at com.atlassian.jira.util.log.RateLimitingLogger.warnWithTrace(RateLimitingLogger.java:163)
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: Hidden field doesn't preset value during customer request creation

*Expected Result:* All issues are transitioned when SLA is breached 
*Actual:* Some issues are not transitioned at 0:00 when SLA is breached.
A search for issues with the SLA column will show many issues in 0:00 but some of them with negative numbers that would mean that the Transition didn't occur in time.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2074].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
When JIRA instance uses other Default System Language, for example German (Deutsch), Service Desk notification will mix both English and German language in the email.

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.3.15
JSD 2.3.6
JSD 2.6.0-OD-11

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA with Service Desk
# Set Default User Preference to use *Text* based email notification
# Change *Indexing Language* and *Default Language* to German (Deutsch)
# Create a Service Desk Request on behalf of customer

h4. Expected Results
Email notification will be fully in German language

h4. Actual Results
There will be a mixed of English and German language in the email
!english.png|thumbnail!

h4. Notes
# The problem *is not observed anymore* in the latest JIRA and Service Desk Server version.
JIRA 6.4.x
JSD 2.5.0
!german.png|thumbnail!
# HTML format email is also showing the translation correctly. Only the Text format is broken
# This is still happening on Cloud instances
# On JIRA Server the issue is happening again in JIRA 7.0.4 and JSD 3.0.4.
 !Screen Shot 2015-12-30 at 8.37.43 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Service Desk email notification uses mixed languages

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2073].
  {panel}

As a JIRA administrator I have all of the users defined in my instance placed in groups so that I can manage them more easily. 

To support this it would be ideal if you could specify on a per service desk basis which groups an invited customer should be added to.

IE: 

* Service Desk 1 has default group for invited customers of customers-service-desk-1
* Service Desk 2 has default group for invited customers of customers-service-desk-2

h3. Advantages of this method:
Makes it easy for me to determine which groups should be allowed access to what, as my support desk agents do not have capacity to deal with user management.
fields.summary: Auto add users invited to a service desk to a group configurable by individual service desk

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2044].
{panel}
{panel:title=Product update 22 March 2021}
Hello all,

As always, thank you for your feedback, votes, and following on this issue.

We have noticed an increase in activity here and wanted to provide an update.

We have heard you loud and clear, and we are increasing our investment in email and notifications. We are in the process of onboarding a dedicated team whose first focus will be some inbound mail issues, most notably JSDCLOUD-2373.

This issue will be on the backlog (including a handful of others). We will share more details as soon as our plans are firmed up. Realistically we don’t expect this work to commence for at least 2 - 3 months.

We appreciate your patience, and look forward to working with you as we solve these important issues.

Cheers,

Ben.
{panel}
Currently, Service Desk notifications will only contain the data relevant to the event that has triggered the notification.
 In order to have a complete overview on mail, having historic data available in the mail notifications would be very convenient to have.
 In particular when forwarding this email to another person to inform them of the reqest, and the history within.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2009].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Agent leaving comment triggers duplicate notification to customer. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
* Create new Service Desk
** Confirm that by default desk is open and customer appears in customer list
* As agent, create issue on behalf of customer 
* Customer receives email, status shows waiting for support
* Agent adds comment using comment box and clicks "Send Response"
** TWO "Service Desk notification rendering mail item" appear in mail queue
* Two notifications received by customer, these are duplicates with conflicting status info. Screenshot attached

h3. Expected Results
The customer should receive only one email.

h3. Actual Results
* The notifications show different statuses
** Old status in one message, destination status in the other
* Both messages show correct destination step in message "Your request status changed to..."

h3. Workaround
Make the Agent use the Comment field in the *Respond to Customer* screen (while doing the transition with the *Respond to customer* button) instead of using the comment field in the View Issue screen. The customer will receive only one email as *Requester action Needed*.




 !Screen Shot 2015-06-23 at 2.40.00 PM.png!
fields.summary: Duplicate Notifications Sent to Customer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2003].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When creating an automation rules in Service desk project, there is only 3 option for SLA time remaining event:
* Due soon (60m remaining)
* At risk (30m remaining)
* Breached

h3. Suggested Solution
Need an ability to accept user input values for the condition. 

h3. Workaround
Similar feature can be achieved by creating an issue filter and then subscribe to the filter to get email notification. The JQL will be something like:
{noformat}
project = DESK and "Time to resolution" <= remaining("15m") and "Time to resolution" != breached()
{noformat}
*Note:* Please change the values accordingly to your environment.
This query will return issues in project "DESK" that it's SLA haven't breached and the remaining SLA is 15 minutes or less.

And then, for the filter subscription, you can choose to send an email every 15 minutes or use "Advanced scheduling ('cron')" for more detailed intervals; [Receiving Search Results via Email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Receiving+Search+Results+via+Email].
fields.summary: Ability to define custom durations for SLA triggered events for automation rules

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1999].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Updating Customer/Agent without transitioning.

h3. Suggested Solution
It is good to have an option to just update the Customer without transitioning the ticket status. As  statuses of waiting for customer and waiting for support make the assumption that each comment made by customers and agents hands the ticket back to the other party. This is not always the case.

h3. Workaround 

The new feature on Service Desk [Introducing automation in JIRA Service Desk 2.4|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2015/04/introducing-automation-jira-service-desk-2-4/] and [Automating your service desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/automating-your-service-desk-733938388.html]

Using [JIRA Automation Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin]
Unfortunately third-party plugins are out of our [support scope|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Support/Atlassian+Support+Offerings]. To get support for the plug-ins you need to contact the related vendor as they have more experience. You can easily find the details of the plug-in at [Atlassian MarketPlace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/].
fields.summary: Being Able to Update Customer/Agent Without Transitioning to Waiting for Customer/Support

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1998].
  {panel}

I'm evaluating Service Desk v2 now.   I got all kinds of permission issues.  Ok I'm a Service Desk Agent (Reporter by default).  Whenever users submit a ticket, I receive an email with a link (see the screenshot below) letting me know some user just submitted a ticket.  But when I clicked on the link, I got "You do not have permissions to view this project".  I checked the "Permission" scheme and I as a Service Desk Agent, do have permission on almost everything. Wondering why I get that message?


Hello ServiceDesk Agent,

Thanks for submitting your request.

You can view the full request details in our Customer
Portal:

https://jira-test.vegaecm.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/5/CSSTI-41
fields.summary: Permission with viewing submitted tickets

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1988].
  {panel}

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.4.6
JIRA Service Desk 2.5.0

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Service Desk
# Create a new Service Desk project
# From the *Queues*, navigate the the first issue, *SD-1*
# Click *Respond to Customer*
# Click the *preview* button
# Click *Exit preview*

h4. Expected Results
The Rich Text Editor bar will still appear

h4. Actual Results
The Rich Text Editor bar disappeared

h4. Workaround
Close the screen, and trigger the transition again to bring back the screen + Rich Text Editor bar
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor bar disappeared after previewing the comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1987].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently *JIRA Service Desk* is keeping emails in its database up to 6 months. This will cause customer's databases (and therefore backups) to grow very fast. 

Consequently, this may even impact the performance of JIRA as it, by default, automatically creates backups every 12 hours. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove emails that are older then 4~6 weeks, which would most likely be already obsolete. 

Alternatively, mark the email as "already processed" when it is processed, and delete those entries with the cleaner job.
fields.summary: Reduce the email age threshold for the JEPP cleaner job.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1981].
  {panel}

A customer would like to be able to get the percentage of issues rather than the number that pass or fail an SLA.

*For Example:*
- Create an SLA.
- In reports, have a report to get issues that breached SLA.
-* This will show the number

*Wanted Feature*
- Add in a feature to show the percentage that meet the query as customer requires this.

*How this can be implemented*
- JIRA can currently count the number of issues  that meet a query as well as total number of issues within a particular (e.g. It can get the total number of issues in that SLA as well as the number that breached or passed the SLA).
- Allow JIRA to then compute using mathematical percentage equation the number that is expected and put this value in a field.
fields.summary: Show Percentage of Issues that Breach SLA in Report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1971].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using a Collaborator account to modify issues in a Service Desk project via API, users won't see a permissions error response - the operation will fail silently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a Service Desk project.
# Set up a user account with full access to the Service Desk project, but without the Service Desk Agent permissions.
# Use API authenticating with the account from point 2 to attempt to modify an issue in the Service Desk project.

h3. Expected Results
API call returns an error about the missing agent permission.

h3. Actual Results
The API response (201) indicates that the call is successful - it's only based on JIRA permissions and doesn't account for the Service Desk permissions override.
 
h3. Notes
Checking the Permission Helper indicates that the Collaborator account won't be able to edit the issue:
{quote}You are trying to perform an agent action on a service desk project. To perform this action, you must have a Service Desk agent license and both Browse and Edit Issue permissions on this project.{quote}
This information should be included in the API response.

h3.Workaround
Grant the API user Service Desk agent permissions.
fields.summary: API Responses Don't Account for Service Desk Permission Override

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1964].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk Customers are unable to login to their Service Desk using the "Sign in Using Google" button on the sign-in page even if their GApps Domain is linked to the Cloud instance

h3. Suggested Solution
As Agents and JIRA/Confluence Users are able to log into their instance using the "Sign in Using Google," Service Desk Customers (who are apart of the same Domain) should be able to login with the same method
 
h3. Workaround 
Login manually using Username/Email and Password combination
fields.summary: Allow Service Desk Customers Login with Google Apps

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1961].
  {panel}

h2.Summary
Replies from a  Service Desk Customer participants are always created as internal comments when the reply made via email. Raising this as a bug because it doesn't make sense to have customer adding internal comments to the request they've raised.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Add a customer into a ticket as a participant.
# Disable Service Desk email channel for the project you are working on.
# Ensure that the participant has permission from JIRA Permission to add comments to the ticket. If you don't do this; SD Customer can't add comments on the ticket.
# Comment on the ticket so that a notification is sent to the participant.
# Reply to the notification as the participant.

h2.Expected Result
Comment will be added as a public comment.

h2.Current Result
Comment will be added as an internal comment.
fields.summary: Email replies by Participants are registered as internal comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1960].
  {panel}

We have a customer interested in allowing all customers that belong to a company to see issues filed by their colleagues.

h5. Use Case
Each company is given one portal and we can restrict who can access the portal by making it invite only so that only members of the company can see the portal.
However, members of each portal cannot still see each others issues nor can they add watchers directly to their issues but would rather need to ask the Agent to add the said customers as watchers so they get notified of progress.

h5. Possible Workaround
- Add a permission scheme at portal level for each Service Desk(A bit similar but not exactly the same as permission in JIRA that allows the Agent further control over customization of each portal.
- Add an option called "View all issues" in the portal Settings that shows or hides a link that allows all issue in the portal so customers can view all issues n the portal.
fields.summary: Allow Option for SD Users to be able to view all issues in their SD Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1951].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

It is possible for customers to add participants from a service desk request.
 It is however not possible to remove participants, for instance, if they have been added in error, or are no longer required as a participant.
 Agents can also not remove participants from within a Service Desk request.
h3. *NOTE:*

Looks like the option to remove request participants for customers from the portal is not available when the below option is chosen:
 !Screenshot 2020-05-27 at 9.00.59 PM.png|thumbnail!

However, remove request participants from the portal is possible when any of the other 2 options are chosen.
 !Screenshot 2020-05-27 at 9.03.11 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the option to remove participants from within Service Desk
h3. Workaround

Participants can get removed from the JIRA view issue screen.
Customers generally can not reach this screen, the only option for them is to request the Agent to remove a participant
fields.summary: Provide ability to remove participants from within Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1947].
  {panel}

h3. Use Case
As a Support Agent who is re-tasked to deal with an over flowing queue I want to be able to comment or provide a notification of some kind on all issues assigned to me so that my customers know that response times may not be as fast as they normally would be on lower priority issues

h3. Notes
* This ability would be most useful as an automation rule that could be applied on a per agent basis
* This cannot occur at issue creation time as issues are created and left unassigned in most use cases I know of
* having the ability to run once, or run on a start/stop time schedule would be ideal
fields.summary: Ability to set customer expectations on a per Agent basis after initial issue creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1939].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

We have too many users to disable the public signup, but we would like to have customers only access the customer portal that they sign up for.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a signup link to a customer portal which new users could use to sign up for a specific portal, this way we do not have to create these accounts manually, but the customer would also not have access to view other customer portals.
fields.summary: As an admin I would like to have users who register via public signup on a specific portal to only have access to that portal.
